law.catch_line: Salary, oath and bond of county administrator.

text.section: The county judge/executive, or the person appointed county alcoholic beverage control administrator under KRS 241.120, shall serve as county administrator without compensation.

Before entering upon his duties as county administrator, the county judge/executive or the appointee shall take the oath prescribed by Section 228 of the Constitution, and execute a bond with a good corporate surety in the penal sum of one thousand dollars ($1,000). The cost of the bond shall be borne by the county. Upon the qualification of any person as county administrator, he shall immediately notify the board.

law.history: Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 2554b-110.
